title: Back-to-back big games for Vestal
text:
Back-to-back big games for Vestal 
By wbng sports October 13, 2015 Updated Oct 13, 2015 at 11:53 PM EDT 
Vestal, NY (WBNG Binghamton) For the first time in 11 tries Vestal beat rival Union-Endicott on the football field last Friday night. The win lifted a giant weight off of the Golden Bears shoulders, but all it did was make this week's game even bigger. 
Both Vestal and Johnson City enter this Friday's game at 1-1 in the division. The winner will finish in second place and get to host the Class A sectional semifinals. 
WBNG E-News - Sign Up For Our Newsletter! 
Coming off a win over their rivals, the Golden Bears hope they can carry over some of their play from last Friday night to this week. 
"If we could bottle it up and carry it on to the next three weeks, we just want to be playing good football right now," said head coach Tank Anderson. "A lot of guys have bought in to what we're trying to do and the guys that are hurt, guys have stepped up. Everyone is contributing and that is a key factor. To have a successful season you've got to get good efforts from guys that haven't played much and get an opportunity to make a play. That's what we did." 
Friday's game between Vestal and JC is at Johnson City at 7 p.m. To submit a comment on this article, your email address is required. We respect your privacy and your email will not be visible to others nor will it be added to any email lists. Most Viewed
